title: Lee Won-young
text:
Lee Won-young (<a href="Hangul">Hangul</a>: 이원영; born 13 March 1981) is a <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player. In 2013, he was renamed from Lee Jung-ho to Lee Won-young.
He has played for formerly <a href="Pohang%20Steelers">Pohang Steelers</a>, <a href="Jeonbuk%20Hyundai%20Motors">Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors</a>, <a href="Jeju%20United">Jeju United</a>, <a href="Saudi%20Arabia">Saudi Arabia</a> side <a href="Al-Ittifaq">Al-Ittifaq</a> and Thai team <a href="Pattaya%20United%20F.C.">Pattaya United</a>.
He was related in the <a href="2011%20South%20Korean%20football%20betting%20scandal">2011 South Korean football betting scandal</a>, and subsequently moved to Saudi side Al-Ittifaq for the 2011/2012 season. However, he was found not guilty and returned to Busan IPark in 2013.
Club career statistics (Busan IPark).
"As of 5 November 2016"
